document.title: Archdiocese of Milwaukee Curriculum Guide, Grade 6

2FA9A6C10CBF4BCDBE7CD0F8B5175466.description: Takes an active role in programs and laws that support and help all forms of life

337CBF217B9345BE90A271FFF4CFE5CB.description: Displays individual and group actions to protect and preserve the environment

36D53D6400C046499C3FB70728B2198D.description: Demonstrates the polices, and behaviors that support a peaceful world

317BF1D444F6425EBD75452EC1964A3D.description: Displays an awareness of responsibility to others throughout the world

D30A1EEC018048E68DD0BB47A4CA07FF.description: Models attitudes and behaviors that accept and value differences (racial, ethnic, economic, etc.)

18CC93F2CE9F4C34AFACF47952335A62.description: Gives examples of the basic rights and responsibilities of workers in at least three different job areas

6E0E4D5AB4E5460E92ED73A8DDF51F6C.description: Demonstrates respect for the basic rights and responsibilities at school and neighborhood

F82B45D3BB924711B1844C2543D9F798.description: Demonstrates putting forth the best effort in school, recreation, and work

C88E48E9D1B14322919F55E65F6FB631.description: Can articulate the importance of intrinsic values

C203F7C1B17341D2A4F09C55400EF4B6.description: Can discuss the role work can play as a contribution to self and society

54F2CCFD104E4481AFCCA8B6F94A888B.description: Dignity of Work and the Rights of Workers

9C430202FECC4A80AD755303F65CA27C.description: Clearly articulates the difference between justice and charity

B01D041972264CDAAC64DD86C35C438E.description:
Does research on the 20th and the 21st century people who have fought for justice, e.g. Archbishop Romero,
Dorothy Day, Martin Luther King

AABB75A17EE142A8A60147EC3E54FC15.description: Can articulate the causes of poverty and the systems which prevent people from overcoming poverty

CB15E422C2164E5BA669C7A098E0D05F.description: Can discuss laws and policies that can benefit the poor and vulnerable members of society

C9D0D2C40F0C4128877DDB9F360DCA2A.description: Shares personal resources to help the poor and vulnerable

1D773766285D4F1E9A20B43537C4F375.description: Option for the Poor and the Vulnerable

1510828341544D95BD9163169C0A901D.description: Researches social data and church teaching as a way to begin to transform injustice

EE0335AB40424A5AB11DB3C5834ED75C.description: Practices peaceful conflict resolution strategies within the family, school, and community

83C8726389724DF78D02E26918C07971.description: Identifies actions that would be considered abuses of human rights (local, national, international)

721225D98FC24002A6771F51BCF4FE96.description: Articulates the component parts of human dignity

072DFB2733BE4D54B3F26B65A3EA5ED7.description: The Rights and Responsibilities of the Human Person:

E00DE36B5974447CAD7E04388928956F.description: Uses the church’s social teachings as a lens to look at the moral and human dimensions of public issues

28B7A6473EA74508B2DA86AD36884F22.description: Is involved in service projects beyond the local community

1474432228204C889EED8465F24691B5.description: Models responsible behavior to family and community through service

3541A9CFB7A7461BB74154C78AC0CA90.description: The Call to Family, Community, and Participation

365B52DD7DD84CFA983D146A35910C9D.description: Identifies Biblical passages related to human dignity

D8AD6F25416241C78320F5888D2410DF.description: Identifies abuses of human dignity found in American Society

F7FC1EC5428F4C6E8DF31E359C405E3C.description: Identifies elements of human dignity based on Catholic Social Teaching

602CAA178D6F4A39859B95AAEB823651.description: Analyzes social issues based on whether human dignity is valued or harmed

C8D03ED3201841028B74E1182B8BEB3A.description: Life and Dignity of the Human Person

D38C9BAB20884B1AB44CEA4B76A17B7F.description: Give examples of media influence on behavior and decision-making of individuals and groups

4DF82012E4CE4FE98101579CFF000F91.description: Analyze cultural conflicts in Unites States History

3637FC3FE1D440ECA887742F8E7061E0.description: Identify examples of bias and stereotyping and how they contribute to conflict

BEF8BAF32926466C92D00E7213F807BA.description: Describe cultural contributions of racial and ethnics groups in the United States and the World

5392F9EB52774B08851FC42A4AA0E170.description: Describe the reflection of cultural values and ideas in art and architecture

1A1A67F4041846099EC4C6E5223D34E6.description: Explain impact of World events globally

7262420F95FD4447A5E44023A54ADAEB.description: Compare and contrast the components of various region’s culture

97D3B7039555414F9F34996EB0C0C6C5.description: Demonstrate knowledge of the World's religions

4D8A2295B5974F128C1B9ACE6B68AB1D.description: Describe cooperation and interdependence among groups, societies, and nations

66B273A6A36F432DA5B750EFFC4ECCAD.description: Describe and explain how various factors influence individual identity

130DF52A5C554A1DB15C2D4B9627FDB8.description: Analyze how various groups of people and cultures govern themselves

D4082224110740CB98FABE176498C4EF.description: Describe the role and effects of international organizations and political alliances throughout the World

DBDD295088D74FD28018A32E75BA2A40.description: Distinguish how the powers of government are acquired, maintained, justified, and sometimes abused

43F7D8ECE7B44C2AB0D53A75DB93E9DA.description: Describe and explain how the federal system separates the powers of federal, state, and local government

E0C4E3887FFC48E988182CCA22C79B5F.description: Explain how legislative, executive, and judicial powers are separated and balanced at the federal level

1ABA26AA39A449EFA2D634ED16D29D4B.description: Identify and explain the different forms of government, including the basic principles of democracy

80DD6BD4B74F45AAB032C8D4DCE11323.description: Explain the role of political parties and interest groups in American politics

E9BEE019947A4BD48674B8F77A6FCBAD.description:
Analyze and discuss important political documents (e.g., the Magna Carta, Constitution, Bill of Rights, and
landmark decisions of the Supreme Court)

93FDC25944134E11978D781E00554CF9.description: Explain how laws are developed, changed, and enforced

C500BB0D97AB468B95E268AC678D4C0D.description: Locate, organize, and use relevant information to understand issues

0BD91855D43F4C6098EA86BD2EE2320E.description: Explain the role and impact of civil actions

B1E156A36746449AA3BF1E96FB93094A.description: Identify individual responsibilities to local, state, national and global communities

DBC80AF7EB6E41B2BD6EF0DABFDF1F3B.description: Demonstrate ways in which a citizen may participate in public policy debates

42AF8DA4F0324875ABBF10D3692E0853.description: Evaluate the impact of science and technology on the United States and the World

E6106410E0D44BFCB15AA7D8202A8CDF.description: Explain the movement of people, ideas, products, and diseases in the World

16A184C68BB54E2BB8EEFB0F50BDB161.description: Identify changing boundaries and major land acquisitions of the United States

647D8854701D4ECB9950563BBC17DAD2.description:
Research the causes and consequences of global issues (e.g., urbanization, extinction of species, consumption of
natural resources, and World events)

3455D37F717246BDA82628A3EDAF6616.description: Describe and analyze ways in which people interact with, modify and adapt with the environment

A5671168EB894AAC91368692D80C1FE6.description:
Understand the different characteristics of climate, landforms, bodies of water, cities, governments, and other
characteristics of place

52F7C9BE49A04B3F8A4580DBAE8FA294.description: Identify components of culture (e.g., religion, art, language, customs, and cuisine)

C9FF37011404494F92803CC944660030.description: Identify United State regions throughout history

46C96AF40A924B43A82ACA7B5B39A171.description: Create different types of maps (e.g., political, physical, and thematic)

6E734A4811EC40E5AA63C8D13CC2C87C.description:
Construct mental maps of selected locales, regions, states, and countries and draw maps from memory,
representing relative location, direction size, and shape

F1943FF131F543DB93AAD4A9528C9B7E.description:
Use an atlas to estimate distance, calculate scale, identify dominant patterns of climate and land use, and
compute population density

A45AEADE24D941458A8C8A94408EA26D.description: Use maps, charts, and graphs to display and compare information

C6941460CCAA407BA9FDA2DE73A4F369.description: Locate and identify physical features in the World

48D816FFF8704908A5A3FDF7546A9CEB.description: Explain relative and absolute location of places using appropriate geographic terminology

5B6AAB5D2CDD4021A0D5958875BC3034.description: Identify past & present countries in the World

F07D8F5547B64301BA72AA2EAADD5410.description: Explain the need for laws and policies to regulate science and technology

181F9E5B9B414AFBAF479528ADD02A71.description:
Identify major scientific discoveries and technological innovations and describe their social and economic effects
on society

3D05BB9A83C14A60B790366C7CF4172D.description: Explain the interpretation of historical events according to various viewpoints

B0CF27694B714644B65AD61E053E98BB.description: Critically analyze current events in the United States and the World

59E3F935F09349518EF889D7EE443F2B.description: Describe the relationship between and among significant events in the United States and World History

F39B6336179B4C259022A05A27E796BE.description: Analyze significant events and the major eras of the United States and the World

EF565340FA034C78988AB86DFA50CDCD.description: Organize and analyze information to place people in historical perspective

167E54F215DE4AE1ABEF81391811EFEC.description:
Research the political values of freedom, democracy, equality, & justice as embodied in important documents
(e.g. the Magna Carta, Declaration of Independence, U.S. Constitution, and the Bill of Rights)

45F9CC7219BF4222A0FAF5E4022D929F.description:
Summarize major issues associated with the history, culture, and tribal sovereignty of the indigenous peoples of
Americas

C4A8F8566EFF4B7AB8DC2FE03E4FF608.description: Examine the impact of immigration on the United States and World History

6FD71AEC991740C394DD6A44E9DBBC27.description: Identify and describe significant people in the major eras in the United States and World History

2B70D3A6492042FD97AFF394001B75E7.description: Analyze the cause and effect relationship of different events over time

96A32AE8135B4A938A192A9136FB0FEE.description: Compare ancient and present-day communities around the World

80BE957259F249EE976DD1D2698F4146.description: Interpret the past using a variety of primary and secondary sources

E2E9AFAF18894FF285DA0CDF231B111F.description:
Identify the economic roles of institutions (e.g., corporations and businesses, banks, labor unions, and the
Federal Reserve System)

3D603BF2DDFA495CAEAA117DA9AF79AD.description:
Distinguish and explain basic economic concepts (e.g., supply and demand; production, exchange, and
consumption; labor, wages, and capital; inflation and deflation; public and private goods and services; market
economy and command economy)

F3347971AAC14307B88BAB1C06558D14.description: Differentiate among the various economic & political systems (e.g., feudalism, capitalism, communism, etc.)

A121D78799A146E5AFAA8D08CFED2B89.description: Interpret and explain the development of money in history

C25DC6F193FC45578885A0173681D9D5.description: Compare the standard of living in various societies

50C7ADEC64CE478F95E0F5F8D9BD0B00.description:
Identify and explain various points of view concerning economic issues (e.g., taxation, unemployment, inflation,
the national debt, and distribution of income)

FE7031447A564EFF9B58E57904529FCF.description:
Describe effects of investments in infrastructure (e.g., education, health care, public safety, transportation, etc.)
on the economy

EF826D053846434583FB26050185E02F.description: Determine the location of natural resources and explain how they generate trade and economic patterns

3B8C2D2CAB504ED0A065344469B31A50.description:
Analyze the impact of personal decisions on global issues (e.g., trade agreements, recycling, and conserving the
environment)

853ECF7FA8B54A8CBFEBE22B557B45E5.description:
Describe how personal economic decisions impact global economy (e.g., starting new business initiatives,
boycotts, and earning power of workers)
